mention.text: The tanker that caused the nation 's biggest oil spill was being illegally piloted by The tanker that caused the nation 's biggest oil spill third mate when the vessel ran aground on a reef

once-pristine Prince William Sound a disaster area as the toll on the waterway 's abundant wildlife began to mount The Coast Guard said the slick and patches of oil separated from Alaska 's were spread over an area of about 100 square miles Exxon Shipping spokesman Brian Dunphy told The Associated Press that the captain of the tanker Exxon Valdez , Joseph Hazelwood , was not on the bridge at the time of the accident and that third mate Gregory Cousins was in command Exxon Shipping Co.
